p:
A model with n directly transmitted pathogen infections illustrates some of the complexity in models with multiple pathogens. The population density in a single host population infected with pathogen j is denoted as I j . An SIR model with mass action incidence and multiple infections but without co‐infections has the form:
(7)
where S(0) = S 0 > 0, I j (0) ≥ 0, R(0) = 0 and N= S+∑
n
j= 1
I j + R. The parameter m is the natural mortality rate, Λ is the immigration/birth rate and α
j is the disease‐related mortality rate. A model with co‐infection by two pathogens, j and k, denoted I jk , would include transmission from I j to I k and from I k to I j .
